Content: i need some help with the latest additions gtc and the other one ðŸ˜…

Author: jorian#4555
Content: so until before those changes, i could define a maxprice and a volume in my buy order. if there was no matching order, nothing would happen and i would need to decrease my volume or increase the price.

Author: jorian#4555
Content: and i dont understand what's happening. first, the volume i specified is lowered to 177 KMD. i get 0.05312 BTC for that, meaning that it has a price of 3358

Author: jorian#4555
Content: that would make it a good deal for me, if it actually connected, which it doesn't: quote validate error -2

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
`gtc:0 fill:1 is fill or kill
gtc:1 fill:1 is a good till canceled and filled
gtc:1 fill:0 is good till cancelled or partially filled`

Author: jorian#4555
Content: so if i define fill:1, the behaviour would be as before the changes?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: and gtc:0

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: afaik, gtc:0 fill:1 *should be* kill any remaining bits not filled

Author: jorian#4555
Content: (there is no documentation about this on docs.komodoplatform.com as far as i can see)

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: and 0 0 is "If I can't fill it all right now, then I don't want anything"

Author: jorian#4555
Content: so why does the above happen

Author: jorian#4555
Content: if i understand you correctly, nothing should've happened

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: it may be that you understand me, but I'm wrong

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: as far as 00, I'm going by what was added to the GUI

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: they put "Fill immediate or cancel order"

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: the 3 I quoted in code tags was direct from james

Author: jorian#4555
Content: ok, i just added fill:1 to my buy and it indeed just killed. i think g.0 f.1 is behaviour as it was before

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: one thing I'm certain of, gtc 1 will go on *forever* ðŸ˜›

Author: jorian#4555
Content: it's like setting autoprice?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: or wait

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: kinda, it reoffers on a timer

Author: jorian#4555
Content: yes, actively? bobs are passively waiting for an offer to come by, but gtc is actively sending such an offer onto the market?

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: 1 1 is kinda like bot offer should be

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: gtc 1 fill 0 is like bot that quits on partial fill

Author: jorian#4555
Content: aha, got it

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content: you can issue a cancel to cli, but you have to know the uuid of the offer

Author: ComputerGenie#2331
Content:
so far, the only UTXO issue I've seen is that if you place multiple gtc 1 fill 1 offers it will sometimes confuse itself and try to use the same UTXO for more than one
at which point the newly "relocked" UTXO can't be used for the original offer that thought it locked it
But I think it's just edge cases like me that will ever have it happen

Author: cipi#4502
Content: i installed the new electrum-servers i got from @noashh ... we now have 3 regions (NA, EU, Asia) with 3 electrums in each regions ... the DNS entries are updated and this is the PR for the coins repo: https://github.com/jl777/coins/pull/104 ... added the third DNS-entry (electrum3), electrum1/2 remained the same (same port) ... had to remove ARG and BLK (ARG wallet is crashing too often and BLK does not work any more, probably because the wallet is very ancient) @pbca26 @lukechilds

Content: If bob is looking for 0.00026, then you want to entice him with 0.000258 not 0.00027

Content: higher than bob if you're buying, lower than bob if you're selling
